translated: The Paṭṭhāna🔽The reverse order of the law of conditionality

original: Dhammapaccanīyānuloma (4), Dukatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (3)🔽21.9. Āsavasāsavaduka, Kusalattika🔽Naāsavañceva naanāsavañca nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā sāsavo ceva noāsavo ca kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.🔽Naāsavañceva naanāsavañca naakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā āsavo ceva sāsavo ca akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma duka tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi  āsavasāsavaduka kusalattika  na āsavañca iva na anāsavañca na kusalam dhammam paccayā sa āsavaḥ ca iva no āsavaḥ ca kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka  na āsavam ca iva na anāsavam ca na akusalam dhammam paccayā āsavaḥ ca iva sa āsavaḥ ca akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: The exposition of conditions in brief

original: Naāsavañceva naanāsavañca naabyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sāsavo ceva no ca āsavo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na āsavañca iva na anāsavañca na abyākatam dhammam paṭicca sa āsavaḥ ca iva no ca āsavaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With an effect that is an effluent and not an effluent and with a cause that is not an effluent and not an effluent, there is a single condition, the condition by way of object. (In brief) … with a cause that is not an effluent and not an effluent, there is a single condition, the condition by way of object.
